taskbody.prereq:
To perform this procedure, you need:
A host with one or more local disks, with at least one unused primary partition.
The password of the root account on the host, or of a user that is a member of the sudo or wheel group.
taskbody.context: Perform this procedure to configure a primary partition on a local disk as swap space. Typically, configuring one swap partition or swap file on each local disk maximizes swap space performance. This procedure does not use Logical Volume Manager (LVM) tools to create a swap space. For more information about LVM, refer to your operating system documentation.

step.cmd: Log in to the target host .
Identify one or more primary partitions for use as swap space.
Create and enable swap space on each target primary partition.

substep.cmd: Disable swapping on all swap devices.

substep.info: Repeat the following command for each primary partition to use as swap space.
substep.stepxmp: Replace Device with the path of a primary partition: mkswap Device

substep.info: Repeat the following command for each swap partition created in the previous substep.
substep.stepxmp: Replace Device with the path of a swap partition: echo "Device swap swap defaults 0 0" >> /etc/fstab

substep.cmd: Enable swapping on all swap devices.
